intro: Pistolochia uniflora, commonly known as the single-flower devil's backbone, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the family Loganiaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, elongated, ridged stems that resemble a backbone. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers that are clustered in dense inflorescences, typically at the base of the stem. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a slightly hairy texture. Pistolochia uniflora is often found in rocky or sandy soils in dry, open habitats.
